question: Who among the following was not a member of the Sarkaria Commission on Centre-State Relations?
explanation: Sarkaria Commission was set up in June 1983 by the central government of India to examine the relationship and balance of power between state and central government. The Commission was so named as it was headed by Justice Rajinder Singh Sarkaria, a retired judge of the Supreme Court of India. The other two members of the committee were Shri B Sivaraman and Dr SR Sen.
